sentences.en: Activity in toubled times is born of superstition, and the ignorant must find consolation in self - delusion.
sentences.cn: 乱世的热闹来自迷信, 愚人的安慰只有自欺.

sentences.en: He is under a delusion in this matter.
He is under the delusion that he is Napoleon.
sentences.cn: 他患了妄想症,认为自己是拿破仑.

sentences.en: He labored under the delusion that he could never make a mistake.
sentences.cn: 他受害于他从来不会出错的幻想.

sentences.en: I talked with Lotte concerning the incredible delusion of the human mind.
sentences.cn: 我和绿蒂谈着关于使人难以置信的人心错觉.

sentences.en: I was under the delusion that he intended to marry me.
Insinuations about her mental state, about her capacity for delusion, were being made.
sentences.cn: 当时有对她的精神状态的影射——说她有妄想症的影射。

sentences.en: It is a delusion from first to last.
It is my conviction , or my delusion , that crime brings its own fatality with it.
sentences.cn: 我深信做坏事总没好报应.

sentences.en: It must need be a delusion.
sentences.cn: 那不过是一种幻觉罢了.

sentences.en: The delusion would doubtless fill her small head with expectations doomed to disappointment.
sentences.cn: 这种迷惘无疑会使她的小脑袋里充满了命定会化为泡影的期望.

sentences.en: The mad boy had a delusion that he was a king.
sentences.cn: 那疯孩子幻想自己是一位国王.

sentences.en: This was not optimism, it was delusion.
This, of course , is a fond delusion.
sentences.cn: 这 当然 是一厢情愿的海市蜃楼.

sentences.en: Tom was under the delusion that he was a VIP.
sentences.cn: 汤姆怀有错觉,认为自己是个要人.

sentences.en: Was it also a slight matter that little Tessa was under a delusion?
sentences.cn: 那么,让小苔莎处于迷惘之中,是不是也是一件小事 呢 ?

trans.tran_en: a false belief about yourself or the situation you are in
